item.description:
Looking for last minute planners (like ourselves!) to hike, sled and play in the snow!  This will be a fun and silly hike all around; experienced and beginner hikers welcome! 

If you are concered about elevation gain and book time, this probably isn't the hike for you (this time around).

We will ascend on foot and descend on sled via the Mt. Tecumseh Trail, approximately 2.4 miles each way (total = 4.8 miles). 

Sense of humor a must.

Sleds are strongly suggested but not mandatory; you could always glissade. 

Necessary winter gear is mandatory, including:

  • Layers, layers, layers
  • Snowshoes
  • Proper traction (ie - micro spikes)
  • Waterproof pants (nice for the sledding)
  • Gloves, hat, etc.
  • ~2L water
  • Trail snacks (or whatever you prefer for caloric nurishment)
  • Sled-proof camera for photos and video

 

Look forward to seeing you there!
item.how_to_find_us: Pete: Brown Curly Hair, Whitish shell; Ash: Orange shell, (stuffed) munkay on her back...pack
item.why: Supposedly the area is getting some freshies...perfect sledding conditions!
item.name: Pete & Ash's Last-Minute Hike/Sled: Mt.Tecumseh, Waterville Valley
